intro: Pentaspadon poilanei, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
